null.verse 28:47: En indien een ramp over hen zou komen wegens hetgeen zij verdienen, mogen zij niet meer zeggen: "Onze Heer, waarom zondt Gij ons geen boodschapper, opdat wij Uwe tekenen hadden kunnen volgen en onder de gelovigen konden zijn?"
null.verse 28:48: Maar toen de Waarheid van Ons tot hen kwam, zeiden zij: "Waarom is hem niet hetzelfde gegeven als aan Mozes werd gegeven?" Verwierpen zij datgene niet, wat Mozes voorheen was gegeven? Zij zeiden: "Twee tovenaars die elkander ondersteunen.
null.verse 28:49: Zeg: "Brengt dan een Boek van God dat een betere leiding geeft dan dit, ik zal dat volgen, indien je waarachtig bent.
null.verse 28:50: Maar als zij u niet antwoorden, weet dan dat zij slechts hun eigen begeerten volgen.
null.verse 28:51: En Wij hebben inderdaad het Woord voortdurend aan hen nedergezonden opdat zij er lering uit mogen trekken.
null.verse 28:52: Zij aan wie Wij het Boek voordien gaven, geloven er in.
null.verse 28:53: En als het aan hen is voorgedragen, zeggen zij: "Wij geloven er in.
null.verse 28:54: Hun beloning zal hun tweemaal worden gegeven want zij zijn standvastig geweest en omdat zij het kwade met het goede weren, en mededelen van hetgeen waarmee Wij hen hebben voorzien.
null.verse 28:55: Wanneer zij ijdele gesprekken horen, wenden zij zich er van af en zeggen: "Aan ons onze werken en aan u uw werken.
null.verse 28:56: Waarlijk, je zult hen die je wilt niet kunnen leiden, maar God leidt wie Hij wil; en Hij kent hen het beste die geleid willen worden.
null.verse 28:57: En zij (de bewoners van Mekka) zeggen: "Als wij de leiding met u zouden volgen, zouden wij van ons land worden weggevoerd.
null.verse 28:58: En hoeveel steden hebben Wij niet vernietigd die trots waren op hun middelen van bestaan! En ginds waren hun woonplaatsen die tot op enkele na niet meer bewoond zijn geworden.
null.verse 28:59: En uw Heer is niet zo, dat Hij steden vernietigt, voordat Hij in de hoofdstad een boodschapper heeft verwekt die hun Ons woord verkondigt; noch verwoesten Wij steden tenzij de bewoners er van onrechtvaardig zijn.
null.verse 28:60: En wat u gegeven is dient slechts als middel van bestaan voor het tegenwoordige leven en ter versiering er van; en hetgeen bij God is, is beter en van langere duur.
null.verse 28:61: Staat hij aan wie Wij een goede belofte hebben gedaan, die hij (vervuld) zal zien, gelijk met degenen, die Wij van de goederen dezer wereld hebben gegeven en zal hij dan op de Dag der Opstanding naar de hel worden gebracht?
null.verse 28:62: En op die Dag zal God hen roepen en zeggen: "Waar zijn Mijn deelgenoten die je beweerde te zijn?"
null.verse 28:63: Zij, tegen wie het Woord van kracht zal worden, zullen zeggen: "Onze Heer, dit zijn degenen die wij deden dwalen.
null.verse 28:64: En er zal worden gezegd: "Roept uw afgoden aan.
null.verse 28:65: En op die Dag zal Hij tot hen roepen en zeggen: "Welk antwoord gaf je (aan Onze) boodschappers?"
null.verse 28:66: Dan zullen alle uitvluchten op die Dag voor hen duister worden en zij zullen elkander niet kunnen vragen.
null.verse 28:67: Maar hij, die berouw heeft, gelooft en goed doet, zal waarschijnlijk tot de geslaagden behoren.
null.verse 28:68: Uw Heer schept en kiest wat Hij wil, zij (de afgoden) hebben geen keuze.
null.verse 28:69: En uw Heer weet wat hun harten verbergen en wat zij openbaren.
null.verse 28:70: En Hij is God; er is geen God naast Hem.
null.verse 28:71: Zeg: "Vertelt mij, als God de nacht over u doet voortduren tot de Dag der Opstanding, welke God is er naast God die u een licht kan brengen? Wil je dan niet luisteren?"
null.verse 28:72: Zeg: "Vertelt mij, als God de dag voor u doet voortduren tot de Dag der Opstanding welke God is er dan naast God die u een nacht kan brengen waarin je kunt rusten? Wil je dat niet inzien?"
null.verse 28:73: Het is door Zijn barmhartigheid dat Hij nacht en dag voor u heeft ingesteld opdat je er in mag rusten en naar Zijn overvloed mag uitzien, en opdat je dankbaar mag zijn.
null.verse 28:74: Gedenkt de dag waarop Hij hen zal oproepen en zeggen: "Waar zijn Mijn mededingers, die gij u placht te verbeelden?"
null.verse 28:75: En Wij zullen uit elk volk een getuige nemen en Wij zullen zeggen: "Brengt uw bewijs.
null.verse 28:76: Korach behoorde voorwaar tot het volk van Mozes, maar hij gedroeg zich aanmatigend tegenover hen.
null.verse 28:77: Maar zoek door hetgeen God u heeft gegeven het tehuis van het Hiernamaals; en vergeet uw deel aan de wereld niet, en doe goed (aan anderen) zoals God u goed gedaan heeft; en schep geen wanorde op aarde, want God heeft hen, die onheil stichten, niet lief.
null.verse 28:78: Hij antuoordde: "Mij werd het alleen door mijn kennis gegeven.
null.verse 28:79: Hij bleef verschijnen voor zijn volk met pracht en praal.
null.verse 28:80: Maar zij, aan wie kennis was gegeven, zeiden: "Wee u, de beloning van God is beter voor degenen die geloven en goede werken doen; en het zal niemand worden geschonken behalve hun die geduldig zijn.
null.verse 28:81: Dan deden Wij hem en zijn huis in de aarde verzinken; en hij had geen partij om hem tegen God te helpen noch kon hij zich verdedigen.
null.verse 28:82: En zij, die zijn plaats de vorige dag hadden begeerd, begonnen (de volgende dag) te zeggen: "O wee, God vergroot en verkleint de voorziening voor wie Hij wil van Zijn dienaren.
null.verse 28:83: Daar is het tehuis van het Hiernamaals! Wij geven het degenen die op aarde geen zelfverheffing wensen, noch wanorde stichten, en het einde is voor de godvruchtigen.
null.verse 28:84: Zij die goed doen worden er beter voor beloond, maar zij die kwaad doen, worden slechts vergolden naar datgene wat zij deden.
null.verse 28:85: Voorwaar, Hij, Die de verkondiging van de Koran u oplegde, zal u tot de plaats van terugkeer brengen.
null.verse 28:86: En je had niet verwacht dat het Boek (de Koran) aan u zou worden geopenbaard; maar het is een barmhartigheid van uw Heer; wees daarom nooit een ondersteuner der ongelovigen.
null.verse 28:87: En laten zij u niet afwenden van de woorden van God nadat zij tot u zijn nedergezonden; en roep anderen tot uw Heer, en behoor niet tot de afgodendienaren.
null.verse 28:88: En roep naast God geen andere God aan.

Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:2: These are revelations of the Scripture that maketh plain.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:3: We narrate unto thee (somewhat) of the story of Moses and Pharaoh with truth, for folk who believe.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:4: Lo! Pharaoh exalted himself in the earth and made its people castes.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:5: And We desired to show favour unto those who were oppressed in the earth, and to make them examples and to make them the inheritors,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:6: And to establish them in the earth, and to show Pharaoh and Haman and their hosts that which they feared from them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:7: And We inspired the mother of Moses, saying: Suckle him and, when thou fearest for him, then cast him into the river and fear not nor grieve.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:8: And the family of Pharaoh took him up, that he might become for them an enemy and a sorrow, Lo! Pharaoh and Haman and their hosts were ever sinning.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:9: And the wife of Pharaoh said: (He will be) a consolation for me and for thee.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:10: And the heart of the mother of Moses became void, and she would have betrayed him if We had not fortified her heart, that she might be of the believers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:11: And she said unto his sister: Trace him.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:12: And We had before forbidden foster-mothers for him, so she said: Shall I show you a household who will rear him for you and take care of him ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:13: So We restored him to his mother that she might be comforted and not grieve, and that she might know that the promise of Allah is true.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:14: And when he reached his full strength and was ripe, We gave him wisdom and knowledge.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:15: And he entered the city at a time of carelessness of its folk, and he found therein two men fighting, one of his own caste, and the other of his enemies; and he who was of his caste asked him for help against him who was of his enemies.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:16: He said: My Lord! Lo! I have wronged my soul, so forgive me.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:17: He said: My Lord! Forasmuch as Thou hast favoured me, I will nevermore be a supporter of the guilty.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:18: And morning found him in the city, fearing, vigilant, when behold! he who had appealed to him the day before cried out to him for help.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:19: And when he would have fallen upon the man who was an enemy unto them both, he said: O Moses! Wouldst thou kill me as thou didst kill a person yesterday.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:20: And a man came from the uttermost part of the city, running.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:21: So he escaped from thence, fearing, vigilant.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:22: And when he turned his face toward Midian, he said: Peradventure my Lord will guide me in the right road.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:23: And when he came unto the water of Midian he found there a whole tribe of men, watering.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:24: So he watered (their flock) for them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:25: Then there came unto him one of the two women, walking shyly.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:26: One of the two women said: O my father! Hire him! For the best (man) that thou canst hire in the strong, the trustworthy.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:27: He said: Lo! I fain would marry thee to one of these two daughters of mine on condition that thou hirest thyself to me for (the term of) eight pilgrimages.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:28: He said: That (is settled) between thee and me.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:29: Then, when Moses had fulfilled the term, and was travelling with his housefolk, he saw in the distance a fire and said unto his housefolk: Bide ye (here).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:30: And when he reached it, he was called from the right side of the valley in the blessed field, from the tree: O Moses! Lo! I, even I, am Allah, the Lord of the Worlds;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:32: Thrust thy hand into the bosom of thy robe it will come forth white without hurt.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:33: He said: My Lord! Lo! I killed a man among them and I fear that they will kill me.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:34: My brother Aaron is more eloquent than me in speech.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:35: He said: We will strengthen thine arm with thy brother, and We will give unto you both power so that they cannot reach you for Our portents.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:36: But when Moses came unto them with Our clear tokens, they said: This is naught but invented magic.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:37: And Moses said: My Lord is Best Aware of him who bringeth guidance from His presence, and whose will be the sequel of the Home (of bliss).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:38: And Pharaoh said: O chiefs! I know not that ye have a god other than me, so kindle for me (a fire), O Haman, to bake the mud; and set up for me a lofty tower in order that I may survey the God of Moses; and lo! I deem him of the liars.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:39: And he and his hosts were haughty in the land without right, and deemed that they would never be brought back to Us.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:40: Therefor We seized him and his hosts, and abandoned them unto the sea.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:41: And We made them patterns that invite unto the Fire, and on the Day of Resurrection they will not be helped.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:42: And We made a curse to follow them in this world, and on the Day of Resurrection they will be among the hateful.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:43: And We verily gave the Scripture unto Moses after We had destroyed the generations of old: clear testimonies for mankind, and a guidance and a mercy, that haply they might reflect.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:44: And thou (Muhammad) wast not on the western side (of the Mount) when We expounded unto Moses the commandment, and thou wast not among those present;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:45: But We brought forth generations, and their lives dragged on for them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:46: And thou was not beside the Mount when We did call; but (the knowledge of it is) a mercy from thy Lord that thou mayst warn a folk unto whom no warner came before thee, that haply they may give heed.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:47: Otherwise, if disaster should afflict them because of that which their own hands have sent before (them), they might say: Our Lord! Why sentest Thou no messenger unto us, that we might have followed Thy revelations and been of the believers ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:48: But when there came unto them the Truth from Our presence, they said: Why is he not given the like of what was given unto Moses ? Did they not disbelieve in that which was given unto Moses of old ? They say: Two magics that support each other; and they say: Lo! in both we are disbelievers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:49: Say (unto them, O Muhammad): Then bring a scripture from the presence of Allah that giveth clearer guidance than these two (that) I may follow it, if ye are truthful.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:50: And if they answer thee not, then know that what they follow is their lusts.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:51: And now verily We have caused the Word to reach them, that haply they may give heed.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:52: Those unto whom We gave the Scripture before it, they believe in it,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:53: And when it is recited unto them, they say: We believe in it.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:54: These will be given their reward twice over, because they are steadfast and repel evil with good, and spend of that wherewith We have provided them,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:55: And when they hear vanity they withdraw from it and say: Unto us our works and unto you your works.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:56: Lo! thou (O Muhammad) guidest not whom thou lovest, but Allah guideth whom He will.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:57: And they say: If we were to follow the Guidance with thee we should be torn out of our land.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:58: And how many a community have We destroyed that was thankless for its means of livelihood! And yonder are their dwellings, which have not been inhabited after them save a little.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:59: And never did thy Lord destroy the townships, till He had raised up in their mother(-town) a messenger reciting unto them Our revelations.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:60: And whatsoever ye have been given is a comfort of the life of the world and an ornament thereof; and that which Allah hath is better and more lasting.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:61: Is he whom We have promised a fair promise which he will find (true) like him whom We suffer to enjoy awhile the comfort of the life of the world, then on the Day of Resurrection he will be of those arraigned ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:62: On the day when He will call unto them and say: Where are My partners whom ye imagined ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:63: Those concerning whom the Word will have come true will say: Our Lord! These are they whom we led astray.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:64: And it will be said: Cry unto your (so-called) partners (of Allah).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:65: And on the Day when He will call unto them and say: What answer gave ye to the messengers ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:66: On that day (all) tidings will be dimmed for them, nor will they ask one of another,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:67: But as for him who shall repent and believe and do right, he haply may be one of the successful.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:68: Thy Lord bringeth to pass what He willeth and chooseth.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:69: And thy Lord knoweth what their breasts conceal, and what they publish.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:70: And He is Allah; there is no God save Him.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:71: Say: Have ye thought, if Allah made night everlasting for you till the Day of Resurrection, who is a god beside Allah who could bring you light ? Will ye not then hear ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:72: Say: Have ye thought, if Allah made day everlasting for you till the Day of Resurrection, who is a god beside Allah who could bring you night wherein ye rest ? Will ye not then see ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:73: Of His mercy hath He appointed for you night and day, that therein ye may rest, and that ye may seek His bounty, and that haply ye may be thankful.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:74: And on the Day when He shall call unto them and say: Where are My partners whom ye pretended ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:75: And We shall take out from every nation a witness and We shall say: Bring your proof.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:76: Now Korah was of Moses’ folk, but he oppressed them; and We gave him so much treasure that the stores thereof would verily have been a burden for a troop of mighty men.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:77: But seek the abode of the Hereafter in that which Allah hath given thee and neglect not thy portion of the world, and be thou kind even as Allah hath been kind to thee, and seek not corruption in the earth; lo! Allah loveth not corrupters,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:78: He said: I have been given it only on account of knowledge I possess.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:79: Then went he forth before his people in his pomp.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:80: But those who had been given knowledge said: Woe unto you! The reward of Allah for him who believeth and doeth right is better, and only the steadfast will obtain it.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:81: So We caused the earth to swallow him and his dwelling-place.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:82: And morning found those who had coveted his place but yesterday crying: Ah, welladay! Allah enlargeth the provision for whom He will of His slaves and straiteneth it (for whom He will).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:83: As for that Abode of the Hereafter We assign it unto those who seek not oppression in the earth, nor yet corruption.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:84: Whoso bringeth a good deed, he will have better than the same; while as for him who bringeth an ill-deed, those who do ill-deeds will be requited only what they did.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:85: Lo! He Who hath given thee the Qur’an for a law will surely bring thee home again.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:86: Thou hadst no hope that the Scripture would be inspired in thee; but it is a mercy from thy Lord, so never be a helper to the disbelievers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:87: And let them not divert thee from the revelations of Allah after they have been sent down unto thee; but call (mankind) unto thy Lord, and be not of those who ascribe partners (unto Him).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 28:88: And cry not unto any other god along with Allah.

Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:2: These are Verses of the Book that makes (things) clear.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:3: We rehearse to thee some of the story of Moses and Pharaoh in Truth, for people who believe.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:4: Truly Pharaoh elated himself in the land and broke up its people into sections, depressing a small group among them: their sons he slew, but he kept alive their females: for he was indeed a maker of mischief.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:5: And We wished to be Gracious to those who were being depressed in the land, to make them leaders (in Faith) and make them heirs,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:6: To establish a firm place for them in the land, and to show Pharaoh, Haman, and their hosts, at their hands, the very things against which they were taking precautions.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:7: So We sent this inspiration to the mother of Moses: "Suckle (thy child), but when thou hast fears about him, cast him into the river, but fear not nor grieve: for We shall restore him to thee, and We shall make him one of Our apostles.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:8: Then the people of Pharaoh picked him up (from the river): (It was intended) that (Moses) should be to them an adversary and a cause of sorrow: for Pharaoh and Haman and (all) their hosts were men of sin.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:9: The wife of Pharaoh said: "(Here is) joy of the eye, for me and for thee: slay him not.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:10: But there came to be a void in the heart of the mother of Moses: She was going almost to disclose his (case), had We not strengthened her heart (with faith), so that she might remain a (firm) believer.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:11: And she said to the sister of (Moses), "Follow him" so she (the sister) watched him in the character of a stranger.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:12: And we ordained that he refused suck at first, until (His sister came up and) said: "Shall I point out to you the people of a house that will nourish and bring him up for you and be sincerely attached to him?".
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:13: Thus did We restore him to his mother, that her eye might be comforted, that she might not grieve, and that she might know that the promise of God is true: but most of them do not understand.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:14: When he reached full age, and was firmly established (in life), We bestowed on him wisdom and knowledge: for thus do We reward those who do good.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:15: And he entered the city at a time when its people were not watching: and he found there two men fighting,- one of his own religion, and the other, of his foes.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:16: He prayed: "O my Lord! I have indeed wronged my soul! Do Thou then forgive me!" So (God) forgave him: for He is the Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:17: He said: "O my Lord! For that Thou hast bestowed Thy Grace on me, never shall I be a help to those who sin!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:18: So he saw the morning in the city, looking about, in a state of fear, when behold, the man who had, the day before, sought his help called aloud for his help (again).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:19: Then, when he decided to lay hold of the man who was an enemy to both of them, that man said: "O Moses! Is it thy intention to slay me as thou slewest a man yesterday? Thy intention is none other than to become a powerful violent man in the land, and not to be one who sets things right!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:20: And there came a man, running, from the furthest end of the City.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:21: He therefore got away therefrom, looking about, in a state of fear.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:22: Then, when he turned his face towards (the land of) Madyan, he said: "I do hope that my Lord will show me the smooth and straight Path.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:23: And when he arrived at the watering (place) in Madyan, he found there a group of men watering (their flocks), and besides them he found two women who were keeping back (their flocks).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:24: So he watered (their flocks) for them; then he turned back to the shade, and said:"O my Lord! truly am I in (desperate) need of any good that Thou dost send me!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:25: Afterwards one of the (damsels) came (back) to him, walking bashfully.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:26: Said one of the (damsels): "O my (dear) father! engage him on wages: truly the best of men for thee to employ is the (man) who is strong and trusty".
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:27: He said: "I intend to wed one of these my daughters to thee, on condition that thou serve me for eight years; but if thou complete ten years, it will be (grace) from thee.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:28: He said: "Be that (the agreement) between me and thee: whichever of the two terms I fulfil, let there be no ill-will to me.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:29: Now when Moses had fulfilled the term, and was travelling with his family, he perceived a fire in the direction of Mount Tur.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:30: But when he came to the (fire), a voice was heard from the right bank of the valley, from a tree in hallowed ground: "O Moses! Verily I am God, the Lord of the Worlds.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:31: "Now do thou throw thy rod!" but when he saw it moving (of its own accord) as if it had been a snake, he turned back in retreat, and retraced not his steps: O Moses!" (It was said), "Draw near, and fear not: for thou art of those who are secure.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:32: "Move thy hand into thy bosom, and it will come forth white without stain (or harm), and draw thy hand close to thy side (to guard) against fear.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:33: He said: "O my Lord! I have slain a man among them, and I fear lest they slay me.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:34: "And my brother Aaron - He is more eloquent in speech than I: so send him with me as a helper, to confirm (and strengthen) me: for I fear that they may accuse me of falsehood.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:35: He said: "We will certainly strengthen thy arm through thy brother, and invest you both with authority, so they shall not be able to touch you: with Our Sign shall ye triumph,- you two as well as those who follow you.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:36: When Moses came to them with Our clear signs, they said: "This is nothing but sorcery faked up: never did we head the like among our fathers of old!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:37: Moses said: "My Lord knows best who it is that comes with guidance from Him and whose end will be best in the Hereafter: certain it is that the wrong-doers will not prosper.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:38: Pharaoh said: "O Chiefs! no god do I know for you but myself: therefore, O Haman! light me a (kiln to bake bricks) out of clay, and build me a lofty palace, that I may mount up to the god of Moses: but as far as I am concerned, I think (Moses) is a liar!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:39: And he was arrogant and insolent in the land, beyond reason,- He and his hosts: they thought that they would not have to return to Us!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:40: So We seized him and his hosts, and We flung them into the sea: Now behold what was the end of those who did wrong!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:41: And we made them (but) leaders inviting to the Fire; and on the Day of Judgment no help shall they find.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:42: in this world We made a curse to follow them and on the Day of Judgment they will be among the loathed (and despised).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:43: We did reveal to Moses the Book after We had destroyed the earlier generations, (to give) Insight to men, and guidance and Mercy, that they might receive admonition.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:44: Thou wast not on the Western side when We decreed the Commission to Moses, nor wast thou a witness (of those events).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:45: But We raised up (new) generations, and long were the ages that passed over them; but thou wast not a dweller among the people of Madyan, rehearsing Our Signs to them; but it is We Who send apostles (with inspiration).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:46: Nor wast thou at the side of (the Mountain of) Tur when we called (to Moses).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:47: If (We had) not (sent thee to the Quraish),- in case a calamity should seize them for (the deeds) that their hands have sent forth, they might say: "Our Lord! why didst Thou not sent us an apostle? We should then have followed Thy Signs and been amongst those who believe!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:48: But (now), when the Truth has come to them from Ourselves, they say, "Why are not (Signs) sent to him, like those which were sent to Moses?" Do they not then reject (the Signs) which were formerly sent to Moses? They say: "Two kinds of sorcery, each assisting the other!" And they say: "For us, we reject all (such things)!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:49: Say: "Then bring ye a Book from God, which is a better guide than either of them, that I may follow it! (do), if ye are truthful!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:50: But if they hearken not to thee, know that they only follow their own lusts: and who is more astray than one who follow his own lusts, devoid of guidance from God? for God guides not people given to wrong-doing.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:51: Now have We caused the Word to reach them themselves, in order that they may receive admonition.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:52: Those to whom We sent the Book before this,- they do believe in this (revelation):
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:53: And when it is recited to them, they say: "We believe therein, for it is the Truth from our Lord: indeed we have been Muslims (bowing to God’s Will) from before this.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:54: Twice will they be given their reward, for that they have persevered, that they avert Evil with Good, and that they spend (in charity) out of what We have given them.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:55: And when they hear vain talk, they turn away therefrom and say: "To us our deeds, and to you yours; peace be to you: we seek not the ignorant.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:56: It is true thou wilt not be able to guide every one, whom thou lovest; but God guides those whom He will and He knows best those who receive guidance.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:57: 057 They say: "If we were to follow the guidance with thee, we should be snatched away from our land.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:58: And how many populations We destroyed, which exulted in their life (of ease and plenty)! now those habitations of theirs, after them, are deserted,- All but a (miserable) few! and We are their heirs!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:59: Nor was thy Lord the one to destroy a population until He had sent to its centre an apostle, rehearsing to them Our Signs; nor are We going to destroy a population except when its members practise iniquity.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:60: The (material) things which ye are given are but the conveniences of this life and the glitter thereof; but that which is with God is better and more enduring: will ye not then be wise?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:61: Are (these two) alike?- one to whom We have made a goodly promise, and who is going to reach its (fulfilment), and one to whom We have given the good things of this life, but who, on the Day of Judgment, is to be among those brought up (for punishment)?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:62: That Day (God) will call to them, and say "Where are my ’partners’?- whom ye imagined (to be such)?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:63: Those against whom the charge will be proved, will say: "Our Lord! These are the ones whom we led astray: we led them astray, as we were astray ourselves: we free ourselves (from them) in Thy presence: it was not us they worshipped.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:64: It will be said (to them): "Call upon your ’partners’ (for help)" :they will call upon them, but they will not listen to them; and they will see the Penalty (before them); (how they will wish) ’if only they had been open to guidance!’
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:65: That Day (God) will call to them, and say: "What was the answer ye gave to the apostles?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:66: Then the (whole) story that Day will seem obscure to them (like light to the blind) and they will not be able (even) to question each other.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:67: But any that (in this life) had repented, believed, and worked righteousness, will have hopes to be among those who achieve salvation.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:68: Thy Lord does create and choose as He pleases: no choice have they (in the matter): Glory to God! and far is He above the partners they ascribe (to Him)!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:69: And thy Lord knows all that their hearts conceal and all that they reveal.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:70: And He is God: There is no god but He.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:71: Say: See ye? If God were to make the night perpetual over you to the Day of Judgment, what god is there other than God, who can give you enlightenment? Will ye not then hearken?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:72: Say: See ye? If God were to make the day perpetual over you to the Day of Judgment, what god is there other than God, who can give you a night in which ye can rest? Will ye not then see?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:73: It is out of His Mercy that He has made for you Night and Day,- that ye may rest therein, and that ye may seek of his Grace;- and in order that ye may be grateful.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:74: The Day that He will call on them, He will say: "Where are my ’partners’? whom ye imagined (to be such)?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:75: And from each people shall We draw a witness, and We shall say: "Produce your Proof": then shall they know that the Truth is in God (alone), and the (lies) which they invented will leave them in lurch.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:76: Qarun was doubtless, of the people of Moses; but he acted insolently towards them: such were the treasures We had bestowed on him that their very keys would have been a burden to a body of strong men, behold, his people said to him: "Exult not, for God loveth not those who exult (in riches).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:77: "But seek, with the (wealth) which God has bestowed on thee, the Home of the Hereafter, nor forget thy portion in this world: but do thou good, as God has been good to thee, and seek not (occasions for) mischief in the land: for God loves not those who do mischief.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:78: He said: "This has been given to me because of a certain knowledge which I have.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:79: So he went forth among his people in the (pride of his wordly) glitter.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:80: But those who had been granted (true) knowledge said: "Alas for you! The reward of God (in the Hereafter) is best for those who believe and work righteousness: but this none shall attain, save those who steadfastly persevere (in good).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:81: Then We caused the earth to swallow up him and his house; and he had not (the least little) party to help him against God, nor could he defend himself.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:82: And those who had envied his position the day before began to say on the morrow: "Ah! it is indeed God Who enlarges the provision or restricts it, to any of His servants He pleases! had it not been that God was gracious to us, He could have caused the earth to swallow us up! Ah! those who reject God will assuredly never prosper.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:83: That Home of the Hereafter We shall give to those who intend not high-handedness or mischief on earth: and the end is (best) for the righteous.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:84: If any does good, the reward to him is better than his deed; but if any does evil, the doers of evil are only punished (to the extent) of their deeds.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:85: Verily He Who ordained the Qur’an for thee, will bring thee back to the Place of Return.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:86: And thou hadst not expected that the Book would be sent to thee except as a Mercy from thy Lord: Therefore lend not thou support in any way to those who reject (God’s Message).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:87: And let nothing keep thee back from the Signs of God after they have been revealed to thee: and invite (men) to thy Lord, and be not of the company of those who join gods with God.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 28:88: And call not, besides God, on another god.

Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:2: Those are the signs of the Manifest Book.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:3: We will recite to thee something of the tiding of Moses and Pharaoh truthfully, for a people who believe.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:4: Now Pharaoh had exalted himself in the land and had divided its inhabitants into sects, abasing one party of them, slaughtering their sons, and sparing their women; for he was of the workers of corruption.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:5: Yet We desired to be gracious to those that were abased in the land, and to make them leaders, and to make them the inheritors,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:6: and to establish them in the land, and to show Pharaoh and Ha man, and their hosts, what they were dreading from them.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:7: So We revealed to Moses’ mother, ’Suckle him, then, when thou fearest for him, cast him into the sea, and do not fear, neither sorrow, for We shall return him to thee, and shall appoint him one of the Envoys.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:8: So then the folk of Pharaoh picked him out to be an enemy and a sorrow to them; certainly Pharaoh and Haman, and their hosts, were of the sinners.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:9: Said Pharaoh’s wife, ’He will be a comfort to me and thee.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:10: On the morrow the heart of Moses" mother became empty, and she wellnigh disclosed him had We not strengthened her heart, that she might be among the believers;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:11: and she said to his sister, ’Follow him,’ and she perceived him from afar, even while they were not aware.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:12: Now We had forbidden to him aforetime to be suckled by any foster-mother; therefore she said, ’Shall I direct you to the people of a household who will take charge of him for you and look after him?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:13: So We returned him to his mother, that she might be comforted and not sorrow, and that she might know that the promise of God is true; but most of them do not know.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:14: And when he was fully grown and in the perfection of his strength, We gave him judgment and knowledge; even so do We recompense the good-doers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:15: And he entered the city, at a time when its people were unheeding, and found there two men fighting; the one was of his own party, and the other was of his enemies.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:16: He said, ’My Lord, I have wronged myself.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:17: He said, ’My Lord, forasmuch as Thou hast blessed me, I will never be a partisan of the sinners.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:18: Now in the morning he was in the city, fearful and vigilant; and behold, the man who had sought his, succour on the day before cried out to him again.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:19: But when he would have assaulted the man who was an enemy to them both, the man said, ’Moses, dost thou’ desire to slay me, even as thou slewest a living ’soul yesterday? Thou only desirest to be a tyrant in the land; thou desirest not to be of them that put things right.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:20: Then came a man from the furthest part of the city, running; he said, ’Moses, the Council are conspiring to slay thee.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:21: So he departed therefrom, fearful and vigilant; he said, ’My Lord, deliver me from the people of the evildoers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:22: And when he turned his face towards Midian he said, ’It may be that my Lord will guide me
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:24: So he drew water for them; then he turned away to the shade, and he said, ’O my Lord, surely I have need of whatever good Thou shalt have sent down upon me.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:25: Then came one of the two women to him, walking modestly, and said, ’My father invites thee, that he may recompense thee with the wage of thy drawing water for us.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:26: Said one of the two women, ’Father, hire him; surely the best man thou canst hire is the one strong and trusty.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:27: He said, ’I desire to marry thee to one of these my two daughters, on condition that thou hirest thyself to me for eight years.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:28: Said he, ’So let it be between me and thee.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:29: So when Moses had accomplished the term and departed with his household, he observed on the side of the Mount a fire.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:30: When he came to it, a voice cried from the right of the watercourse, in the sacred hollow, coming from the tree: ’Moses, I am God, the Lord of all Being.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:32: Insert thy hand into thy bosom, and it will come forth white without evil; and press to thee thy arm, that thou be not afraid.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:33: Said he, ’My Lord, I have indeed slain a living soul among them, and I fear that they will slay me.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:34: Moreover my brother Aaron is more eloquent than I.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:35: Said He, ’We will strengthen thy arm by means of thy brother, and We shall appoint.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:36: So when Moses came to them with Our signs, clear signs, they said, ’This is nothing but a forged sorcery.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:37: But Moses said, ’My Lord knows very well who comes with the guidance from Him, and shall possess the Ultimate Abode; surely the evildoers will not prosper.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:38: And Pharaoh said, ’Council, I know not that you have any god but me.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:39: And he waxed proud in the land, he and his hosts, wrongfully; and they thought they should not be returned to Us.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:40: Therefore We seized him and his hosts, and cast their into the sea; so behold how was the end of the evildoers!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:41: And We appointed them leaders, calling to the Fire; and on the Day of Resurrection they shall not be helped;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:42: and We pursued them in this world with a curse, and on the Day of Resurrection they shall be among the spurned.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:43: And We gave Moses the Book, after that We had destroyed the former generations, to be examples and a guidance and a mercy, that haply so they might remember.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:44: Thou wast not upon the western side when We decreed to Moses the commandment, nor wast thou of those witnessing;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:45: but We raised up generations, and long their lives continued.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:46: Thou wast not upon the side of the Mount when We called; but for a mercy from thy Lord, that thou mayest warn a people to whom no warner came before thee, and that haply they may remember.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:47: Else, did an affliction visit them for that their own hands have forwarded then they might say, ’Our Lord, why didst Thou not send a Messenger to us that we might follow Thy signs and so be among the believers?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:48: Yet when the truth came to them ’from Ourselves, they said, ’Why has he not been given the like’ of that Moses was given?’ But they, did they not disbelieve also in what Moses was given aforetime? They said, ’A pair of sorceries mutually supporting each other.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:49: Say: ’Bring a Book from God that gives better guidance than these, and follow it, if you speak truly.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:50: Then if they do not answer thee, know that they are only following their caprices; and who is further astray than he who follows his caprice without guidance from God? Surely God guides not the people of the evildoers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:51: Now We have brought them the Word; haply they may remember.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:52: Those to whom We gave the Book before this believe in it
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:53: and, when it is recited to them, they say, ’We believe in it; surely it is the truth from our Lord.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:54: These shall be given their wage twice over for that they patiently endured, and avert evil with good, and expend of that We have provided them.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:55: When they hear idle talk, they turn away from it and say, ’We have our deeds, and you your deeds.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:56: Thou guidest not whom thou likest, but God guides whom He wills, and knows very well those that are guided.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:57: They say, ’Should we follow the guidance with thee, we shall be snatched from our land.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:58: How many a city We have destroyed that flourished in insolent ease! Those are their dwelling-places, undwelt in after them, except a little; Ourselves are the inheritors.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:59: Yet thy Lord never destroyed the cities until He sent in their mother-city a Messenger, to recite Our signs unto them; and We never destroyed the cities, save that their inhabitants were evildoers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:60: Whatever thing you have been given is the enjoyment of the present life and its adornment; and what is with God is better and more enduring.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:61: Will you not understand? What, is he to whom We have promised a fair promise, and he receives it, like him to whom We have given the enjoyment of the present life, then he on the Resurrection Day shall be of those that are arraigned?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:62: Upon the day when He shall call to them, and He shall say, ’Where now are My associates whom you were asserting?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:63: Those against whom the Word is realized they shall say, ’Our Lord, those whom we perverted, we perverted them even as we ourselves erred.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:64: It shall be said, ’Call you now upon your associates!’ And they will call upon them, but they shall not answer them, and they shall see the chastisement-ah, if they had been guided!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:65: Upon the day when He shall call to them, and He shall say, ’What answer gave you to the Envoys?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:66: Upon that day the tidings will be darkened for them, nor will they ask each other.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:67: But as for him who repents, and believes, and works righteousness, haply he shall be among the prosperers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:68: Thy Lord creates whatsoever He will and He chooses; they have not the choice.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:69: And thy Lord knows what their breasts conceal and what they publish.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:70: And He is God; there is no god but He.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:71: Say: ’What think you? If God should make the night unceasing over you, until the Day of Resurrection, what god other than God shall bring you illumination? Will you not hear?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:72: Say: ’What think you? If God should make the day unceasing over you, until the Day of Resurrection, what god other than God shall bring you night to repose in? Will you not see?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:73: Of His mercy He has appointed for you night and day, for you to repose in and seek after His bounty, that haply you will be thankful.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:74: Upon the day when He shall call.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:75: And We shall draw out from every nation a witness, and say, ’Produce your proof!’ Then will they know that Truth is God’s, and there shall go astray from them that they were forging.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:76: Now Korah was of the people of Moses; he became insolent to them, for We had given him treasures such that the very keys of them were too heavy a burden for a company of men endowed with strength.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:77: but seek, amidst that which God has given thee, the Last Abode, and forget not thy portion of the present world; and do good, as God has been good to thee.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:78: He said, ’What I have been given is only because of a knowledge that is in me.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:79: So he went forth unto his people in his adornment.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:80: But those to whom knowledge had been given said, ’Woe upon you! The reward of God is better for him who believes, and works righteousness; and none shall receive it except the steadfast.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:81: So We made the earth to swallow him and his dwelling and there was no host to help him, apart from God, and he was helpless;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:82: and in the morning those who had longed to be in his place the day before were saying, ’Ah, God outspreads and straitens His provision to whomsoever He will of His servants.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:83: That is the Last Abode; We appoint it for those who desire not exorbitance in the earth, nor corruption.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:84: Whoso brings a good deed shall have better than it; and whoso brings an evil deed those who have done evil deeds shall only be recompensed for that they were doing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:85: He who imposed ’the Recitation upon thee.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:86: Thou didst not hope that the Book should be cast unto thee, except it be as a mercy from thy Lord; so be thou not a partisan of the unbelievers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:87: Let them not bar thee from the signs of God, after that they have been sent down to thee.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 28:88: And call not upon another god with God; there is no god but He.

Muhammad Asad.verse 28:2: THESE ARE MESSAGES of a divine writ clear in itself and clearly showing the truth.
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:4: convey unto thee some of the story of Moses and Pharaoh, setting forth the truth for [the benefit of] people who will believe.
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:5: Behold, Pharaoh exalted himself in the land and divided its people into castes.
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:6: their women: for, behold, he was one of those who spread corruption [on earth].
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:7: But it was Our will to bestow Our favour upon those [very people] who were deemed
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:8: utterly low in the land, and to make them forerunners in faith, and to make them heirs [to Pharaoh’s glory],
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:9: and to establish them securely on earth, and to let Pharaoh and Hāmān and their hosts experience through those [children of Israel] the very thing against which they sought to protect themselves.
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:10: And so, [when he was born,] We inspired
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:11: the mother of Moses: "Suckle him [for a time], and then, when thou hast cause to fear for him, cast him into the river, and have no fear and do not grieve – for We shall restore him to thee, and shall make him one of Our message-bearers!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:12: And [some of] Pharaoh’s household found [and spared] him: for [We had willed] that he become an enemy unto them and [a source of] grief, seeing that Pharaoh and Hāmān and their hosts were sinners indeed!
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:13: Now the wife of Pharaoh said: "A joy to the eye [could this child be] for me and thee! Slay him not: he may well be of use to us, or we may adopt him as a son!" And they had no presentiment [of what he was to become].
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:14: On the morrow, however, an aching void grew up in the heart of the mother of Moses, and she would indeed have disclosed all about him had We not endowed her heart with enough strength to keep alive her faith [in Our promise].
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:15: And so she said to his sister, "Follow him" – and [the girl] watched him from afar, while they [who had taken him in] were not aware of it.
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:16: Now from the very beginning We caused him to refuse the breast of
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:17: nurses; and [when his sister came to know this,] she said: "Shall I guide you to a family that might rear him for you, and look after him with good will?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:18: And thus We restored him to his mother, so that her eye might be gladdened, and that she might grieve no longer, and that she might know that God’s promise always comes true – even though most of them know it not!
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:20: reached full manhood and had become mature [of mind] We bestowed upon him the ability to judge [between right and wrong] as well as
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:21: knowledge: for thus do We reward the doers of good.
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:22: And [one day] he entered the city at a time when [most of] its people were [resting in their houses,] unaware of what was going on [in the streets]; and there he encountered two men fighting with one another – one of his own people, and the other of his enemies.
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:26: he prayed: O my Sustainer! Verily, I have sinned against myself! Grant me, then, Thy forgiveness!" And He forgave him – for, verily, He alone is truly-forgiving, a dispenser of grace.
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:27: Said he: "O my Sustainer! [I vow] by all the blessings which Thou hast bestowed on me: Nevermore shall I aid such as are lost in sin!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:28: And next morning he found himself in the city, looking fearfully about him, when lo! the one who had sought his help the day before [once again] cried out to him [for help – whereupon] Moses said unto him: "Behold, thou art indeed, most clearly, deeply in the wrong!
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:29: But then, as soon as he was about to lay violent hands on the man who was their
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:30: enemy, the latter exclaimed: "O Moses, dost thou intend to slay me as thou didst slay another man yesterday? Thy sole aim is to become a tyrant in this land, for thou dost not care to be of those who would set things to rights!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:31: And [then and there] a man came running from the farthermost end of the city, and said: "O Moses! Behold, the great ones [of the kingdom] are deliberating upon thy case with a view to killing thee! Begone, then: verily, I am of those who wish thee well!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:32: So he went forth from thence, looking fearfully about him, and prayed: "O my Sustainer! Save me from all evildoing folk!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:33: And as he turned his face towards Madyan, he said [to himself]: "It may well be that my Sustainer will
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:34: guide me onto the right path!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:35: NOW WHEN he arrived at the wells of Madyan, he found there a large group of men who were watering [their herds and flocks]; and at some distance from them he came upon two women who were keeping back their flock.
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:36: "What is the matter with you?" They answered: "We cannot water [our animals] until the herdsmen drive
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:37: home – for [we are weak and] our father is a very old man.
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:38: So he watered [their flock] for them; and then he withdrew into the shade and prayed: "O my Sustainer! Verily, in dire need am I of any good which Thou mayest bestow upon me!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:41: approached him, walking shyly, and said: "Behold, my father invites thee, so that he might duly reward thee for thy having watered [our flock] for us.
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:42: came unto him and told him the story [of his life], he said: "Have no fear! Thou art now safe from those evildoing folk!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:44: "O my father! Hire him: for, behold, the best
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:45: that thou couldst hire is one who is
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:46: strong and worthy of trust [as he]!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:47: [After some time, the father] said: "Behold, I am willing to let thee wed one of these two daughters of mine on the understanding that thou wilt remain eight years in my service; and if thou shouldst complete ten ,
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:48: that would be [an act of grace] from thee, for I do not want to impose any hardship on thee: [on the contrary,] thou wilt find me, if God so wills, righteous in all my dealings.
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:50: "Thus shall it be between me and thee! Whichever of the two terms I fulfil, let there be no ill-will against me.
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:51: AND WHEN Moses had fulfilled his term, and was wandering with his family [in the desert], he perceived a fire on the slope of Mount Sinai; [and so] he said to his family: "Wait here.
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:52: But when he came close to it, a call was sounded from the right-side bank of the valley, out of the tree
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:53: on blessed ground: "O Moses! Verily, I am God, the Sustainer of all the worlds!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:54: And [then He said]: "Throw down thy staff!" But as soon as
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:55: saw it move rapidly, as if it were a snake, he drew back [in terror], and did not [dare to] return.
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:56: "[And now] put thy hand into thy bosom: it will come forth
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:58: hold thine arm close to thyself, free of all fear.
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:60: "O my Sustainer! I have slain one of them, and so I fear that they will slay me.
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:61: And my brother Aaron – he is far better in speech than I am.
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:62: Said He: "We shall strengthen thine arm through thy brother, and endow both of you with power, so that they will not be able to touch you: by virtue of Our messages shall you two, and all who follow you, prevail!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:63: BUT AS SOON as Moses came unto them with Our clear messages [Pharaoh and his great ones] said: "All this is nothing but spellbinding eloquence devised [by man]: and never did we hear [the like of] this, [nor has it ever been heard of] in the time of our forebears of old!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:64: And Moses replied: "My Sustainer knows best as to who comes with guidance from Him, and to whom the future belongs! Verily, never will evildoers attain to a happy state!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:65: Whereupon Pharaoh said: "O you nobles! I did not know that you could have any deity other than myself! Well, then, O Hāmān, kindle me a fire for [baking bricks of] clay, and then build me a lofty tower, that haply I may have a look at the god of Moses – although, behold, I am convinced that he is of those who
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:67: Thus arrogantly, without the least good sense, did he and his hosts behave on earth – just as if they thought that they would never have to appear before Us [for judgment]!
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:68: And so We seized him and his hosts and cast them into the sea: and behold what happened in the end to those evildoers:
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:69: [We destroyed them,] and We set them up as archetypes [of evil] that show the way to the fire [of hell]; and
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:70: no succour will come to them on Resurrection Day,
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:71: We have caused a curse to follow them in this world as well; and on Resurrection Day they will find themselves among those who are bereft of all good.
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:73: indeed, after We had destroyed those earlier generations [of sinners], We vouchsafed unto Moses
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:74: revelation as a means of insight for men, and as a guidance and grace, so that they might bethink themselves [of Us].
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:75: NOW [as for thee, O Muhammad,] thou wert not present on the sunset slope [of Mount Sinai] when We imposed the Law upon Moses, nor wert thou among those who witnessed [his times]:
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:76: nay, but [between them and thee] We brought into being
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:77: generations, and long was their span of life.
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:79: And neither wert thou present on the slope of Mount Sinai when We called out [to Moses]: but [thou, too, art sent] as an act of thy Sustainer’s grace, to warn people to whom no warner has come before thee, so that they might bethink themselves [of Us];
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:80: and [We have sent thee] lest they say [on Judgment Day], when disaster befalls them as an outcome of what their own hands have wrought, "O our Sustainer, if only Thou hadst sent an apostle unto us, we would have followed Thy messages, and would have been among those who believe!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:81: And yet, now that the truth has come unto them from Us, they say, "Why has he not been vouchsafed the like of what Moses was vouchsafed?" But did they not also, before this, deny the truth of what Moses was vouchsafed?
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:82: they do say, "Two examples of delusion,
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:83: supporting each other!" And they add, "Behold, we refuse to accept either of them as true!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:85: revelation from God which would offer better guidance than either of these two –
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:86: I shall follow it, if you speak the truth! "
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:87: And since they cannot respond to this thy challenge, know that they are following only their own likes and dislikes: and who could be more astray than he who follows
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:88: his own likes and dislikes without any guidance from God? Verily, God does not grace with His guidance people who are given to evildoing!
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:89: NOW, INDEED, We have caused this word [of Ours] to reach mankind step by step, so that they might [learn to] keep it in mind.
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:90: As for those unto whom We have vouchsafed revelation aforetime – they [are bound to] believe in this one [as well];
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:92: conveyed unto them, they [are bound to] profess, "We have come to believe in it, for, behold, it is the truth from our Sustainer – and, verily, even before this have we surrendered ourselves unto Him!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:93: These it is that shall receive a twofold reward for having been patient in adversity, and having repelled evil with good, and having spent on others out of what We provided for them as sustenance,
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:94: and, whenever they heard frivolous talk, having turned away from it and said: "Unto us shall be accounted our deeds, and unto you, your deeds.
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:95: we do not seek out such as are ignorant [of the meaning of right and wrong].
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:96: VERILY, thou canst not guide aright everyone whom thou lovest: but it is God who guides him that wills [to be guided]; and He is fully aware of all who would let themselves be guided.
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:97: Now some say, "If we were to follow the guidance to which thou invitest us.
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:98: things? But most of them are unaware [of this truth].
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:99: And how many a community that
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:100: exulted in its wanton wealth and ease of life have We destroyed, so that those dwelling-places of theirs – all but a few – have never been dwelt-in after them: for it is indeed We alone who shall remain when all else will have passed away!
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:101: Yet, withal, thy Sustainer would never destroy a community without having
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:102: raised in its midst an apostle who would convey unto them Our messages; and never would We destroy a community unless its people are wont to do wrong [to one another].
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:106: enjoyment of life in this world, and for its embellishment – whereas that which is with God is [so much] better and more enduring.
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:107: Is, then, he to whom We have given that goodly promise which he shall see fulfilled [on his resurrection] comparable to one on whom We have bestowed
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:108: the enjoyments of this worldly life but who, on Resurrection Day, will find himself among those that shall be arraigned [before Us]?
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:109: For on that Day He will call unto them, and will ask: "Where, now, are those [beings or powers] whom you imagined to have a share in My divinity?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:111: they against whom the word [of truth] shall thus stand revealed will exclaim: "O our Sustainer! Those whom we caused to err so grievously, we but caused to err as we ourselves had been erring.
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:112: disavow them before Thee: it was not us that they worshipped!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:115: unto those [beings or powers] to whom you were wont to ascribe a share in God’s divinity!" -and they will call unto them [for help], but those [false objects of worship] will not respond to them: whereupon they will see the suffering [that awaits them – the suffering which could have been avoided] if only they had allowed themselves to be guided!
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:116: And on that Day He will call unto them, and will ask: "How did you respond to My message-bearers?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:117: but all arguments and excuses will by then have been erased from their minds, and they will not [be able to] obtain any
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:119: But as against this – anyone who repents and attains to faith and does righteous deeds may well [hope to] find himself among those who achieve a happy state [in the life to come]
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:120: AND [thus it is:] thy Sustainer creates whatever He wills; and He chooses [for mankind] whatever is best for them.
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:121: And thy Sustainer knows all that their hearts conceal as well as all that they bring into the open:
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:122: for He is God, save whom there is no deity.
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:124: If God had willed that there should always be night about you, without break, until the Day of Resurrection – is there any deity other than God that could bring you light? Will you not, then, listen [to the truth]?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:126: If God had willed that there should always be daylight about you, without break, until the Day of Resurrection – is there any deity other than God that could bring you [the darkness of] night, wherein you might rest? Will you not, then, see [the truth]?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:127: For it is out of His grace that He has made for you the night and the day, so that you might rest therein as well as seek to obtain [what you need] of His bounty: and [He gave you all this] so that you might have cause to be grateful.
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:128: AND ON THAT DAY He will call unto those [that shall have been arraigned before His judgment seat], and will ask: "Where, now, are those [beings or powers] whom you imagined to have a share in My divinity?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:129: And [they will remain silent: for by then] We will have called forth witnesses from within every community, and will have said [unto the sinners]: "Produce an evidence for what you have been claiming!" And so they will come to understand that all truth is God’s :
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:130: and all their false imagery will have forsaken them.
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:132: BEHOLD, Qārūn was one of the people of Moses; but he arrogantly exalted himself above them – simply because We had granted him such riches that his treasure-chests alone would surely have been too heavy a burden for a troop of ten strong men or even more.
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:133: Seek instead, by means of what God has granted thee, [the good of] the life to come, without forgetting, withal, thine own
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:134: share in this world; and do good [unto others] as God has done good unto thee; and seek not to spread corruption on earth: for, verily, God does not love the spreaders of corruption!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:136: has been given to me only by virtue of the knowledge that is in me!" Did he not know that God had destroyed [the arrogant of] many a generation that preceded him – people who were greater than he in power, and richer in what they had amassed? But such as are lost in sin may not be asked about their sins.
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:137: And so he went forth before his people in all his pomp;
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:138: those who cared only for the life of this world would say, "Oh, if we but had the like of what Qārūn has been given! Verily, with tremendous good fortune is he endowed!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:139: But those who had been granted true knowledge said: "Woe unto you! Merit in the sight of God is by far the best for any who attains to faith and does what is right: but none save the patient in adversity can ever achieve this .
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:140: And thereupon We caused the earth to swallow him and his dwelling; and he had none and nothing to succour him against God, nor was he of those who could succor themselves.
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:141: And on the morrow, those who but yesterday had longed to be in his place exclaimed: "Alas [for our not having been aware] that it is indeed God
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:142: who grants abundant sustenance, or gives it in scant measure, unto whichever He wills of His creatures! Had not God been gracious to us, He might have caused [the earth] to swallow us, too! Alas [for our having forgotten] that those who deny the truth can never attain to a happy state!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:144: life in the hereafter, We grant it
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:145: to those who do not seek to exalt themselves on earth, nor yet to spread corruption: for the future belongs to the God-conscious.
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:146: Whosoever shall come [before God] with a good deed will gain
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:147: good therefrom; but as for any who shall come with an evil deed – [know that] they who do evil deeds will not be requited with more than [the like of] what they have done.
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:148: VERILY, [O believer,] He who has laid down this Qur’ān in plain terms, making it binding on thee, will assuredly bring thee back [from death] to a life renewed.
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:149: Now [as for thyself, O believer,] thou couldst never foresee that this divine writ would [one day] be offered to thee: but [it did come to thee] by thy Sustainer’s grace.
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:150: and never let them turn thee away from God’s messages after they have been bestowed upon thee from on high: instead, summon [all men] to thy Sustainer.
Muhammad Asad.verse 28:151: and never call upon any other deity side by side with God.

Martin Lings.verse 28:1: Verily thou guidest not whom thou lovest, but God guideth whom He will.
Martin Lings.verse 28:2: God createth what He will, according to His Choice.
Martin Lings.verse 28:3: Say: Have ye thought if God made night everlasting upon you till the Day of the Resurrection, who is a god beside God to bring you light? Will ye then not hear?
Martin Lings.verse 28:4: Say: Have ye thought, if God made day everlasting upon you till the Day of the Resurrection, who is a god beside God to bring you a night wherein to rest? Will ye not then see?
Martin Lings.verse 28:5: And of his mercy hath he made for you night and day, that therein ye may rest and that ye may go seek His favours, and that ye may be thankful.
Martin Lings.verse 28:6: Verily He who hath made binding upon thee the Koran will bring thee home once more.
Martin Lings.verse 28:7: …there is no God but He: all things are perishable but His Face.
